channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023070068
item.description:
Report E-2023070068

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 15, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of sulfuric acid was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted surface. AS identified the damaged pail and solidified the remaining contents in one (1) 30-gallon drum. AS deployed absorbents to the product on the concrete and utilized hand tools to collect the impacted solids in a separate 30-gallon drum. Both drums were labeled and staged onsite to be profiled by R+L personnel

item.title: Report X-2023061529
item.description:
Report X-2023061529

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager called out for a leaking package on door 112 in load side. Upon QA's arrival package was placated inside a grey bin by manager because package was leaking to much and giving off a strong odor from it. QA came and took the package with the bin since it contained all of the liquid that spill out from the package. DescribePack: One of the paint cans had been bent and crushed which lead to the lid to pop off and spill the grey metallic liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to hazmat cage and put next to a air vent to air out the strong odor coming from it. The hazmat package was then placated inside a hazmat bag with all the spill liquid and paint cans with some absorbent.

item.title: Report E-2023060798
item.description:
Report E-2023060798

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 13, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1170 was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews observed the leaking 55-gallon drum had been placed on its side to prevent any further leaking. One (1) gallon of ethanol solution was estimated to have released to the dock floor. AS personnel deployed granular absorbents to the ethanol solution-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. The leaking 55-gallon drum and the collected spent absorbents were containerized into one (1) 95-gallon overpack. This overpack was labeled with a "hazardous" label and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2023060793
item.description:
Report E-2023060793

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UKC experienced a battery acid release from an 1830-pound UN2794 Battery, Wet, Filled with Acid. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 3' x 10' area of the trailer floor and concrete dock due to the battery falling over as a result of a pallet failure. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The battery was wiped down and re-secured for shipment on. All impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in a lined hazardous materials bin outside of QA cage. QA processed the hazmat. Box had an odor coming out of it, and a hole was eaten through the box. DescribePack: Upon internal inspection, there was one bottle that was shiny and leaking. The leak accumulated on one side of the box and seems like it ate through the fiberboard box. There was a 4 inch hole on one non-closure side of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a hazardous materials plastic bag and put into a hazardous materials red container.

item.title: Report X-2023061157
item.description:
Report X-2023061157

  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in the load side with the top corners of the box wet. The box was placed in a red hazardous bin with 1 layer of absorbent, a hazardous materials bag, and another layer of absorbent. DescribePack: Box was found stained from the outer top corners. Upon inspection the inner top flaps of the box were found stained and a little bit of the corners. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spillage was not actively leaking so only 1 sheet of absorbent was used to cover that part of the box. It was then placed in a bin layered with absorbent and a hazardous materials bag.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found inside drivers van, with the code 10 (INSPECTION REQUIRED) applied to package. Package was found separated from other packages, behind the drivers seating area, on the floor. DescribePack: 2 caps were loose on the bottles, causing the liquid from inside to leak out. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was pulled and placed in the hazmat cage, near the ventilation fan. During the inspection of the package, the caps were sealed back on securely.

item.title: Report X-2023061145
item.description:
